intro: Silene guntensis subsp. vallicola, commonly known as the valley catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, pinkish to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Silene guntensis subsp. vallicola is an important species in its ecosystem, supporting pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of high-altitude regions.
